task.title: Saving you work and exiting
task.shortdesc: Onto our final guide and once again arguably the most important one. We've managed to create our small island and now it's time to save our work.

context.p: Probably our shortest and most important task. It's time to save our work! Let's see how it's done:

step.cmd: Hover your cursor over to the top left corner of the screen and click the drop down menu.
Now that we've opened the menu hover your mouse over to the "Save" option and click it. Alternatively you can press "Ctrl+S" on your keyboard to use the save shortcut.

This brought up the name window. Write down the name for your map. I've chosen to name this map "Tutorial Island". Once you've selected a name either click the blue "Ok" button or "Enter" key on your keyboard.

Now that we've successfully saved our work go back to the drop down menu on the top left corner, click it and hover down to the "Return to your maps" option. Click it to exit the map editor and go back to your maps. There you will see you newly made map.

taskbody.result: And so we've finally reached the end of our journey! Now that you've made your first map you can always go back to view or edit it through the "My Maps" section on Inkarnate.
